message:
# Take a look at these movie posters. All of these movies had an important role in them - A Teacher/ Mentor / Coach. 
# With respect to this role, which of these movies did you like the most? And why?

comments.message: We would love to know which of these movies you liked and why SRIDHAR.V Daisy Kavitha. P and Manjunath :)
3 idiot's......
3 idiots

I like 3 idiots and Tare Zameen Par

In 3 idiots; As per my view The Knowledge not only comes from book, We try to notice in which are the Person is able to achieve, is able to get self esteem instead of success the man should grab what his mind tells not what others says to him... This movie also taught me we have to take out inner talent of a Child or Youths... Then only we will be happy, we will get what career we  want.

#Tare Zameen par; 
This movie gives great lesson ~ Every child is Unique, even he suffering from #Dyslexia #Dyscalculia #Dysgraphia like diseases. As Teacher/Facilitator we should create learning atmosphere more joyfully and Creatively.

1. How to learn these SKILLS in  Trainer Tribe 
2. What you say about this ?

# HOW DO YOU GREET YOUR STUDENTS EVERYDAY? 

Did you ever think about the first time you meet your students in the day and what that is like? Is there a formality, is there fun and easiness, is there fear? What is the energy that you create?

Here's a strategy to learn from :)

comments.message: My personal experience is I usually give smile to everyone with saying hi 🖐️/good morning /you all are looking awesome today.... They really feels comfortable & it gives a positive energy to start a class.
I believe that by greeting students that will bring trainers and students on same platform and they might get open to us and due to that facilitation becomes much more easy
Its very nice video...i ll apply the same....till now i was greeting like hello good morning and how was ur previous day and when they leave the class i say to them bye and see you soon.

message:
# Endless meetings.. work deadlines.. traffic..problems with the boss...relationship trouble.. etc etc 
# Stress is part of our everyday life..
# But what is stress? What causes stress? 
# And what can we do to deal with it?  
# Watch this video to understand stress and learn a few simple techniques to take control of it before it controls you.  
# *How do you manage stress in your daily life? *

Today conducted a guest session on Health, Nutrition & Menstruation Cycle for "girls student of GOVT ITI, Ajmer.  One of the main objective  of  this session was "to create an understanding about health and awareness  about menstruation cycle."

**Topics were-: **

1.Health,its importance and factors affecting health

2. Nutrition, deficiency of nutrition and Balanced diet

3. An important topic was also covered with the context of women/girls, that was about  the **anemia, menstruation cycle, hygiene during periods and myths about periods in our society. ** 

**Feedback from students-: ** Before  this session I tried to talk about this with girls and I got to know that they are unaware about the menstruation cycle, why it happen with them/only with girls. That time I also found hesitation in them. some of them started smiling.   

After the session girls said that they got to know about their  body, importance and process of menstruation cycle, hygiene during periods time & myths about periods in our society.

1.  (aaj se phle itna apne shareer ke bare me nhi janti thi jo aaj class me jan ne ko mila)

2.Gender ke bare me janko mila jo hame pata hona chahiye.

"And the best part was that distributed sticky notes to all so that they can write easily. (Because i felt this time again they can feel hesitate) Suddenly they said that they can ask in front of everyone. they do not have any problem. (Quest classes ka kamal)"

comments.message: This is awesome Pallavi Mishra.
This is a great effort, Pallavi Mishra! These are indeed critical inputs for young women.
Amazing effort Pallavi Mishra to open up students on topics that are considered sensitive !
Excellent effort :) Pallavi Mishra
Narayanan Poomulli
Wow

message:
Guest lecture on Gender Equality at Saraspur ITI by Gurjeet Kaur (CEO of Janvikas). 
Do read description in comment section.

comments.message:
One interesting brainstorming activity done by Gurjeet mam with students by asking simple questions of day to day life like

If chicken is ordered or made and only one tangdi (leg pcs) pcs is available who will eat in your home or who will have chance to eat at your home?
Mother or father

When girls are allowed to wear shirts and jeans, why boys are not allowed to wear sarees and bangles?
When we were kids we wished to wear bangles by looking their vibrant color but then our family members always tried and convinced us by saying this is item of girls, you are a boy you are not allowed to wear.
From very start we were taught and conditioned like there is huge difference between boy and girl.

But there is no such thing like that, the only difference is our reproductive organs apart from it we all are humans.

Students thought and replied themselves after sometime that yes there is so much of inequality in small small aspects in our life.

We have to start from at our home first...we need to observe and address each and every thing that is happening at our home and try to question ourselves "why"?

There were many questions asked to students they were amazed to know that.

It was very interesting session.
Thanks for sharing those questions Vijay Sukhani!

Wonderful! There was a recent article shared here on asking questions .. Read article here: https://epaper.thehindu.com/Home/ShareArticle?OrgId=GCI3VJTEQ.1&imageview=1  The other obvious and safer place where kids can start asking questions is their homes.
Thank you Vijay Sukhani for sharing mind striking questions

message:
Career Club Member Placement 
GANDHI FELLOWSHIP 2018
*Opportunity to Change One Million Lives*

Gandhi Fellowship is a nationally and internationally  reputed 2 year full time residential program to help youth to develop skills in leadership, build competencies among youth to bring positive, exponential and lasting change in the society.
It’s a matter of pride and pleasure for the Department of Social Work Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapith, Varanasi.
Five students have been selected for this well reputed fellowship.
Name of students are:
1- Mr. Ramesh Kumar – MSW IV Sem. 2018
2- Mr. Amit Kumar Sharma- MSW IV Sem. 2018
3- Ms. Himani Verma- M.A. IRPM IV Sem. 2018
4- Ms. Jayalaxmi- M.A. IRPM IV Sem. 2018
5- Ms. Neha Maurya- M.A. IRPM IV Sem. 2018
